attrs.script:
#!/bin/bash
set -ex
##############################################
# Name        : Hadoop_Master_Configure.sh
# Author      : Calm Devops
# Version     : 1.0
# Description : Script to configure Hadoop master with slave details
# Compatibility : Centos 6, 7
##############################################
cd /usr/local/hadoop 

sudo mkdir -p /data/1/dfs/nn /nfsmount/dfs/nn
sudo chmod 777 /data/1/dfs/nn /nfsmount/dfs/nn

if [[ ! -f etc/hadoop/mapred-site.xml ]];then touch etc/hadoop/mapred-site.xml;fi

sudo mv etc/hadoop/hdfs-site.xml etc/hadoop/hdfs-site.xml.backup
sudo mv etc/hadoop/core-site.xml etc/hadoop/core-site.xml.backup
sudo mv etc/hadoop/mapred-site.xml etc/hadoop/mapred-site.xml.backup
sudo mv etc/hadoop/yarn-site.xml etc/hadoop/yarn-site.xml.backup

### Configure hdfs-site.xml
hdfs_site_xml=$(cat <<EOF
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<?xml-stylesheet type="text/xsl" href="configuration.xsl"?>
<configuration>
<property><name>dfs.permissions.superusergroup</name><value>hadoop</value></property>
<property><name>dfs.namenode.name.dir</name><value>file:///data/1/dfs/nn,file:///nfsmount/dfs/nn</value></property>
<property>
    <name>dfs.datanode.data.dir</name>
    <value>file:///data/1/dfs/dn,file:///data/2/dfs/dn,file:///data/3/dfs/dn,file:///data/4/dfs/dn</value>
</property>
<property>
    <name>dfs.namenode.http-address</name>
    <value>#@#IPADDRESS#@#:50070</value>
    <description>The address and the base port on which the dfs NameNode Web UI will listen.</description>
</property>
<property><name>dfs.namenode.datanode.registration.ip-hostname-check</name><value>false</value></property>  
</configuration>
EOF
)
echo $hdfs_site_xml | sudo tee etc/hadoop/hdfs-site.xml
sudo sed -i -e 's/#@#IPADDRESS#@#/@@{address}@@/g' etc/hadoop/hdfs-site.xml

### Configure core-site.xml
core_site_xml=$(cat <<EOF
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<?xml-stylesheet type="text/xsl" href="configuration.xsl"?>
<configuration>
<property><name>fs.defaultFS</name><value>hdfs://#@#IPADDRESS#@#</value></property>
<property><name>hadoop.proxyuser.mapred.groups</name><value>*</value></property>
<property><name>hadoop.proxyuser.mapred.hosts</name><value>*</value></property>
</configuration>
EOF
)
echo $core_site_xml | sudo tee etc/hadoop/core-site.xml
sudo sed -i -e 's/#@#IPADDRESS#@#/@@{address}@@/g' etc/hadoop/core-site.xml

### Configure mapred-site.xml
mapred_site_xml=$(cat <<EOF
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<?xml-stylesheet type="text/xsl" href="configuration.xsl"?>
<configuration>
<property><name>mapreduce.framework.name</name><value>yarn</value></property>
<property><name>yarn.app.mapreduce.am.staging-dir</name><value>/user</value></property>
<property><name>mapreduce.jobhistory.address</name><value>@#IPADDRESS#@#:10020</value></property>
<property><name>mapreduce.jobhistory.webapp.address</name><value>#@#IPADDRESS#@#:19888</value></property>
</configuration>
EOF
)
echo $mapred_site_xml | sudo tee etc/hadoop/mapred-site.xml
sudo sed -i -e 's/#@#IPADDRESS#@#/@@{address}@@/g' etc/hadoop/mapred-site.xml


### Configure yarn-site.xml
yarn_site_xml=$(cat <<EOF
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<?xml-stylesheet type="text/xsl" href="configuration.xsl"?>
<configuration>
  <property>
    <name>yarn.nodemanager.aux-services</name>
    <value>mapreduce_shuffle</value>
  </property>
  <property>
    <name>yarn.nodemanager.aux-services.mapreduce_shuffle.class</name>
    <value>org.apache.hadoop.mapred.ShuffleHandler</value>
  </property>
  <property>
    <name>yarn.log-aggregation-enable</name>
    <value>true</value>
  </property>
  <property>
    <description>Where to store container logs.</description>
    <name>yarn.nodemanager.log-dirs</name>
    <value>file:///var/log/hadoop-yarn/containers</value>
  </property>
  <property>
    <description>Where to aggregate logs to.</description>
    <name>yarn.nodemanager.remote-app-log-dir</name>
    <value>hdfs://var/log/hadoop-yarn/apps</value>
  </property>
  <property>
    <description>Classpath for typical applications.</description>
     <name>yarn.application.classpath</name>
     <value>
        \$HADOOP_CONF_DIR,
        \$HADOOP_COMMON_HOME/*,\$HADOOP_COMMON_HOME/lib/*,
        \$HADOOP_HDFS_HOME/*,\$HADOOP_HDFS_HOME/lib/*,
        \$HADOOP_MAPRED_HOME/*,\$HADOOP_MAPRED_HOME/lib/*,
        \$HADOOP_YARN_HOME/*,\$HADOOP_YARN_HOME/lib/*
     </value>
  </property>
  <property>
    <name>yarn.resourcemanager.hostname</name>
    <value>#@#IPADDRESS#@#</value>
  </property>
  <property>
    <name>yarn.nodemanager.local-dirs</name>
    <value>file:///data/1/yarn/local,file:///data/2/yarn/local,file:///data/3/yarn/local</value>
  </property>
</configuration>
EOF
)
echo $yarn_site_xml | sudo tee etc/hadoop/yarn-site.xml
sudo sed -i -e 's/#@#IPADDRESS#@#/@@{address}@@/g' etc/hadoop/yarn-site.xml

echo ""> /usr/local/hadoop/etc/hadoop/slaves

echo "Master @@{address}@@ is configured"

echo 'export HADOOP_HOME=/usr/local/hadoop' >> .bash_profile
#echo 'export HADOOP_COMMON_HOME=/usr/local/hadoop' >> .bash_profile
#echo 'export HADOOP_COMMON_HOME=$HADOOP_HOME/share/hadoop/common' >> .bash_profile
#echo 'export HADOOP_HDFS_HOME=$HADOOP_HOME/share/hadoop/hdfs' >> .bash_profile
#echo 'export HADOOP_MAPRED_HOME=$HADOOP_HOME/share/hadoop/mapred' >> .bash_profile
#echo 'export HADOOP_YARN_HOME=$HADOOP_HOME/share/hadoop/yarn' >> .bash_profile
echo 'export HADOOP_COMMON_LIB_NATIVE_DIR=$HADOOP_COMMON_HOME/lib/native' >> .bash_profile
echo 'export HIVE_HOME=/home/centos/apache-@@{hive_version}@@-bin' >> .bash_profile
echo 'export JAVA_HOME=`ls -d /usr/lib/jvm/java-*/jre| head -1`' >> .bash_profile
echo 'export JAVA_HOME=`ls -d /usr/lib/jvm/java-*/jre| head -1`' >> /usr/local/hadoop/etc/hadoop/hadoop-env.sh
echo 'export PATH=$JAVA_HOME/bin:$HADOOP_COMMON_HOME/bin:$PATH' >> .bash_profile
echo 'export CLASSPATH=.:$JAVA_HOME/jre/lib:$JAVA_HOME/lib:$JAVA_HOME/lib/tools.jar:$HADOOP_COMMON_HOME:$HADOOP_HDFS_HOME:$HADOOP_MAPRED_HOME:$HADOOP_YARN_HOME' >> .bash_profile
source ~/.bash_profile

sudo yum install -y firewalld
sudo systemctl start firewalld
sudo systemctl enable firewalld
sudo systemctl status firewalld

sudo firewall-cmd --permanent --zone=public --add-port=8020/tcp
sudo firewall-cmd --permanent --zone=public --add-port=8088/tcp
sudo firewall-cmd --permanent --zone=public --add-port=50070/tcp
sudo firewall-cmd --reload

attrs.script:
#!/bin/bash

##############################################
# Name        : Hadoop_Master_Start.sh
# Author      : Calm Devops
# Version     : 1.0
# Description : Script to start Hadoop master services
# Compatibility : Centos 6, 7
##############################################

cd /usr/local/hadoop
bin/hadoop namenode -format

sh sbin/start-dfs.sh
sh sbin/start-yarn.sh

echo "Master service started"

if [[ "@@{Install_Sqoop}@@" == "False" ]];then exit 0 ; fi

echo "Download sqoop binary"
wget http://archive.apache.org/dist/sqoop/@@{sqoop_version}@@/@@{sqoop_binary}@@.tar.gz
tar -xvf @@{sqoop_binary}@@.tar.gz
sudo mv @@{sqoop_binary}@@ /usr/lib/sqoop
#cd /usr/lib/sqoop



#cd $SQOOP_HOME/conf
#mv sqoop-env-template.sh sqoop-env.sh
wget http://ftp.ntu.edu.tw/MySQL/Downloads/Connector-J/@@{mysql_binary}@@.tar.gz
tar -zxf @@{mysql_binary}@@.tar.gz
cd @@{mysql_binary}@@
sudo mkdir -p /usr/lib/sqoop
#sudo  mv @@{mysql_binary}@@.jar /usr/lib/sqoop/lib
sudo mv @@{mysql_binary}@@.jar /usr/lib/sqoop

echo 'export SQOOP_HOME=/usr/lib/sqoop' >> ~/.bash_profile
echo 'export SQOOP_SERVER_EXTRA_LIB=/usr/lib/sqoop' >> ~/.bash_profile
echo 'export PATH=$SQOOP_HOME/bin:$PATH' >> ~/.bash_profile
echo 'export CLASSPATH=.:$JAVA_HOME/jre/lib:$JAVA_HOME/lib:$JAVA_HOME/lib/tools.jar:$HADOOP_COMMON_HOME:$HADOOP_HDFS_HOME:$HADOOP_MAPRED_HOME:$HADOOP_YARN_HOME:SQOOP_SERVER_EXTRA_LIB' >> ~/.bash_profile

source ~/.bash_profile
# Remove the Apache Hive from the classpath to prevent java.lang.ExceptionInInitializerError during upgrade

export PATH=$JAVA_HOME/bin:$HADOOP_COMMON_HOME/bin:$SQOOP_HOME/bin:$PATH
export CLASSPATH=.:$JAVA_HOME/jre/lib:$JAVA_HOME/lib:$JAVA_HOME/lib/tools.jar:$HADOOP_COMMON_HOME:$HADOOP_HDFS_HOME:$HADOOP_MAPRED_HOME:$HADOOP_YARN_HOME:SQOOP_SERVER_EXTRA_LIB


$SQOOP_HOME/bin/sqoop2-server start

if [[ "@@{Install_Hive}@@" == "False" ]];then exit 0 ; fi

echo 'export PATH=$JAVA_HOME/bin:$HADOOP_COMMON_HOME/bin:$HIVE_HOME/bin:$PATH' >> ~/.bash_profile
source ~/.bash_profile
wget --no-check-certificate https://dlcdn.apache.org/hive/@@{hive_version}@@/apache-@@{hive_version}@@-bin.tar.gz
echo "Extracting Hive binaries"
tar -xzf apache-@@{hive_version}@@-bin.tar.gz
cd apache-@@{hive_version}@@-bin

source ~/.bash_profile
echo "Making Hadoop Temp Directory"
sudo $HADOOP_HOME/bin/hadoop fs -mkdir /tmp
sudo $HADOOP_HOME/bin/hadoop fs -mkdir -p /user/hive/warehouse
sudo $HADOOP_HOME/bin/hadoop fs -chmod g+w /tmp
sudo $HADOOP_HOME/bin/hadoop fs -chmod g+w /user/hive/warehouse
echo "Testing the Hive cli"
$HIVE_HOME/bin/hive --version

#!/bin/bash

set -ex

##############################################
# Name        : Hadoop_Master_setup.sh
# Author      : Calm Devops
# Version     : 1.0
# Description : Script to setup Hadoop master 
# Compatibility : Centos 6, 7
##############################################

echo '@@{SSHUSER.secret}@@' > .ssh/id_rsa
echo 'Host *
 StrictHostKeyChecking no' > .ssh/config
chmod 600  .ssh/*

#sudo yum update -y
sudo yum install -y wget java-1.8.0-openjdk java-1.8.0-openjdk-devel

cd /usr/local
sudo wget https://archive.apache.org/dist/hadoop/core/hadoop-2.10.1/hadoop-2.10.1.tar.gz
sudo tar -xvzf hadoop-2.10.1.tar.gz
sudo chown -R @@{SSHUSER.username}@@ hadoop-2.10.1.tar.gz
sudo mv hadoop-2.10.1 hadoop

echo "Master setup done"

#!/bin/bash

set -ex

##############################################
# Name        : Hadoop_Master_uninstall.sh
# Author      : Calm Devops
# Version     : 1.0
# Description : Script to uninstall hadoop master 
# Compatibility : Centos 6, 7
##############################################


sudo yum remove -y wget java-1.8.0-openjdk
sudo yum -y remove cloudera-cdh-5-0.x86_64.rpm 
sudo yum -y remove zookeeper-server
sudo yum -y remove hadoop*

<?xml version="1.0"?>

</property>

</configuration>
EOF
)
echo $hdfs_site_xml | sudo tee etc/hadoop/hdfs-site.xml
sudo sed -i -e 's/#@#IPADDRESS#@#/@@{Hadoop_Master.address}@@/g' etc/hadoop/hdfs-site.xml

### Configure core-site.xml
core_site_xml=$(cat <<EOF
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<?xml-stylesheet type="text/xsl" href="configuration.xsl"?>
<configuration>
<property><name>fs.defaultFS</name><value>hdfs://#@#IPADDRESS#@#</value></property>
<property><name>hadoop.proxyuser.mapred.groups</name><value>*</value></property>
<property><name>hadoop.proxyuser.mapred.hosts</name><value>*</value></property>
</configuration>
EOF
)
echo $core_site_xml | sudo tee etc/hadoop/core-site.xml
sudo sed -i -e 's/#@#IPADDRESS#@#/@@{Hadoop_Master.address}@@/g' etc/hadoop/core-site.xml

### Configure mapred-site.xml

<?xml version="1.0"?>
<?xml-stylesheet type="text/xsl" href="configuration.xsl"?>
<configuration>
<property><name>mapreduce.framework.name</name><value>yarn</value></property>

<configuration>

    <value>mapreduce_shuffle</value>
  </property>

attrs.script:
sudo yum install -y --quiet lvm2 libudev-devel
pv_list=""		# This variable will store all the unused/unclaimed disks
for x in {a..z}; do
   if [ -e /dev/sd$x ];	# For all providers except AWS
   then
      data_flag=`sudo file -sL /dev/sd$x | cut -d ':' -f2 | tr -d ' '`	# It will be 'data' if disk is not claimed / used
      if [ "$data_flag" == "data" ]
      then
      sudo pvcreate /dev/sd$x
      pv_list+="/dev/sd$x "
      fi
   elif [ -e /dev/xvd$x ];	# AWS disks
   then
      data_flag=`sudo file -sL /dev/xvd$x | cut -d ':' -f2 | tr -d ' '`
      if [ "$data_flag" == "data" ]
      then
        sudo pvcreate /dev/xvd$x
        pv_list+="/dev/xvd$x "
      fi
   fi
done

if [[ ! -z $pv_list ]]; then
	eval sudo vgcreate vg01 $pv_list # vg01 is created with all unclaimed / unused disks
    if [[ `sudo vgdisplay vg01` ]];then echo "vg01 already exists";exit 0;fi
    sudo lvcreate -l 100%VG -n lv01 vg01	# lv01 is created from vg01
	sudo mkfs.xfs /dev/vg01/lv01
	echo -e "/dev/vg01/lv01 \t /opt \t xfs \t defaults \t 0 0" | sudo tee -a /etc/fstab # lv01 is mounted to /opt
	sudo mount -a
fi

sudo yum install -y --quiet lvm2 libudev-devel
pv_list=""		# This variable will store all the unused/unclaimed disks
for x in {a..z}; do
   if [ -e /dev/sd$x ];	# For all providers except AWS
   then
      data_flag=`sudo file -sL /dev/sd$x | cut -d ':' -f2 | tr -d ' '`	# It will be 'data' if disk is not claimed / used
      if [ "$data_flag" == "data" ]
      then
      sudo pvcreate /dev/sd$x
      pv_list+="/dev/sd$x "
      fi
   elif [ -e /dev/xvd$x ];	# AWS disks
   then
      data_flag=`sudo file -sL /dev/xvd$x | cut -d ':' -f2 | tr -d ' '`
      if [ "$data_flag" == "data" ]
      then
        sudo pvcreate /dev/xvd$x
        pv_list+="/dev/xvd$x "
      fi
   fi
done

if [[ ! -z $pv_list ]]; then
	eval sudo vgcreate vg01 $pv_list # vg01 is created with all unclaimed / unused disks
    if [[ `sudo vgdisplay vg01` ]];then echo "vg01 already exists";exit 0;fi
    sudo lvcreate -l 100%VG -n lv01 vg01	# lv01 is created from vg01
	sudo mkfs.xfs /dev/vg01/lv01
	echo -e "/dev/vg01/lv01 \t /opt \t xfs \t defaults \t 0 0" | sudo tee -a /etc/fstab # lv01 is mounted to /opt
	sudo mount -a
fi

attrs.script:
#!/bin/bash
set -ex
##############################################
# Name        : Hadoop_Master_Configure.sh
# Author      : Calm Devops
# Version     : 1.0
# Description : Script to configure Hadoop master with slave details
# Compatibility : Centos 6, 7
##############################################
cd /usr/local/hadoop 

sudo mkdir -p /data/1/dfs/nn /nfsmount/dfs/nn
sudo chmod 777 /data/1/dfs/nn /nfsmount/dfs/nn

if [[ ! -f etc/hadoop/mapred-site.xml ]];then touch etc/hadoop/mapred-site.xml;fi

sudo mv etc/hadoop/hdfs-site.xml etc/hadoop/hdfs-site.xml.backup
sudo mv etc/hadoop/core-site.xml etc/hadoop/core-site.xml.backup
sudo mv etc/hadoop/mapred-site.xml etc/hadoop/mapred-site.xml.backup
sudo mv etc/hadoop/yarn-site.xml etc/hadoop/yarn-site.xml.backup

### Configure hdfs-site.xml
hdfs_site_xml=$(cat <<EOF
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<?xml-stylesheet type="text/xsl" href="configuration.xsl"?>
<configuration>
<property><name>dfs.permissions.superusergroup</name><value>hadoop</value></property>
<property><name>dfs.namenode.name.dir</name><value>file:///data/1/dfs/nn,file:///nfsmount/dfs/nn</value></property>
<property>
    <name>dfs.datanode.data.dir</name>
    <value>file:///data/1/dfs/dn,file:///data/2/dfs/dn,file:///data/3/dfs/dn,file:///data/4/dfs/dn</value>
</property>
<property>
    <name>dfs.namenode.http-address</name>
    <value>#@#IPADDRESS#@#:50070</value>
    <description>The address and the base port on which the dfs NameNode Web UI will listen.</description>
</property>
<property><name>dfs.namenode.datanode.registration.ip-hostname-check</name><value>false</value></property>  
</configuration>
EOF
)
echo $hdfs_site_xml | sudo tee etc/hadoop/hdfs-site.xml
sudo sed -i -e 's/#@#IPADDRESS#@#/@@{address}@@/g' etc/hadoop/hdfs-site.xml

### Configure core-site.xml
core_site_xml=$(cat <<EOF
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<?xml-stylesheet type="text/xsl" href="configuration.xsl"?>
<configuration>
<property><name>fs.defaultFS</name><value>hdfs://#@#IPADDRESS#@#</value></property>
<property><name>hadoop.proxyuser.mapred.groups</name><value>*</value></property>
<property><name>hadoop.proxyuser.mapred.hosts</name><value>*</value></property>
</configuration>
EOF
)
echo $core_site_xml | sudo tee etc/hadoop/core-site.xml
sudo sed -i -e 's/#@#IPADDRESS#@#/@@{address}@@/g' etc/hadoop/core-site.xml

### Configure mapred-site.xml
mapred_site_xml=$(cat <<EOF
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<?xml-stylesheet type="text/xsl" href="configuration.xsl"?>
<configuration>
<property><name>mapreduce.framework.name</name><value>yarn</value></property>
<property><name>yarn.app.mapreduce.am.staging-dir</name><value>/user</value></property>
<property><name>mapreduce.jobhistory.address</name><value>@#IPADDRESS#@#:10020</value></property>
<property><name>mapreduce.jobhistory.webapp.address</name><value>#@#IPADDRESS#@#:19888</value></property>
</configuration>
EOF
)
echo $mapred_site_xml | sudo tee etc/hadoop/mapred-site.xml
sudo sed -i -e 's/#@#IPADDRESS#@#/@@{address}@@/g' etc/hadoop/mapred-site.xml


### Configure yarn-site.xml
yarn_site_xml=$(cat <<EOF
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<?xml-stylesheet type="text/xsl" href="configuration.xsl"?>
<configuration>
  <property>
    <name>yarn.nodemanager.aux-services</name>
    <value>mapreduce_shuffle</value>
  </property>
  <property>
    <name>yarn.nodemanager.aux-services.mapreduce_shuffle.class</name>
    <value>org.apache.hadoop.mapred.ShuffleHandler</value>
  </property>
  <property>
    <name>yarn.log-aggregation-enable</name>
    <value>true</value>
  </property>
  <property>
    <description>Where to store container logs.</description>
    <name>yarn.nodemanager.log-dirs</name>
    <value>file:///var/log/hadoop-yarn/containers</value>
  </property>
  <property>
    <description>Where to aggregate logs to.</description>
    <name>yarn.nodemanager.remote-app-log-dir</name>
    <value>hdfs://var/log/hadoop-yarn/apps</value>
  </property>
  <property>
    <description>Classpath for typical applications.</description>
     <name>yarn.application.classpath</name>
     <value>
        \$HADOOP_CONF_DIR,
        \$HADOOP_COMMON_HOME/*,\$HADOOP_COMMON_HOME/lib/*,
        \$HADOOP_HDFS_HOME/*,\$HADOOP_HDFS_HOME/lib/*,
        \$HADOOP_MAPRED_HOME/*,\$HADOOP_MAPRED_HOME/lib/*,
        \$HADOOP_YARN_HOME/*,\$HADOOP_YARN_HOME/lib/*
     </value>
  </property>
  <property>
    <name>yarn.resourcemanager.hostname</name>
    <value>#@#IPADDRESS#@#</value>
  </property>
  <property>
    <name>yarn.nodemanager.local-dirs</name>
    <value>file:///data/1/yarn/local,file:///data/2/yarn/local,file:///data/3/yarn/local</value>
  </property>
</configuration>
EOF
)
echo $yarn_site_xml | sudo tee etc/hadoop/yarn-site.xml
sudo sed -i -e 's/#@#IPADDRESS#@#/@@{address}@@/g' etc/hadoop/yarn-site.xml

echo ""> /usr/local/hadoop/etc/hadoop/slaves

echo "Master @@{address}@@ is configured"

echo 'export HADOOP_HOME=/usr/local/hadoop' >> .bash_profile
#echo 'export HADOOP_COMMON_HOME=/usr/local/hadoop' >> .bash_profile
#echo 'export HADOOP_COMMON_HOME=$HADOOP_HOME/share/hadoop/common' >> .bash_profile
#echo 'export HADOOP_HDFS_HOME=$HADOOP_HOME/share/hadoop/hdfs' >> .bash_profile
#echo 'export HADOOP_MAPRED_HOME=$HADOOP_HOME/share/hadoop/mapred' >> .bash_profile
#echo 'export HADOOP_YARN_HOME=$HADOOP_HOME/share/hadoop/yarn' >> .bash_profile
echo 'export HADOOP_COMMON_LIB_NATIVE_DIR=$HADOOP_COMMON_HOME/lib/native' >> .bash_profile
echo 'export HIVE_HOME=/home/centos/apache-@@{hive_version}@@-bin' >> .bash_profile
echo 'export JAVA_HOME=`ls -d /usr/lib/jvm/java-*/jre| head -1`' >> .bash_profile
echo 'export JAVA_HOME=`ls -d /usr/lib/jvm/java-*/jre| head -1`' >> /usr/local/hadoop/etc/hadoop/hadoop-env.sh
echo 'export PATH=$JAVA_HOME/bin:$HADOOP_COMMON_HOME/bin:$PATH' >> .bash_profile
echo 'export CLASSPATH=.:$JAVA_HOME/jre/lib:$JAVA_HOME/lib:$JAVA_HOME/lib/tools.jar:$HADOOP_COMMON_HOME:$HADOOP_HDFS_HOME:$HADOOP_MAPRED_HOME:$HADOOP_YARN_HOME' >> .bash_profile
source ~/.bash_profile

sudo yum install -y firewalld
sudo systemctl start firewalld
sudo systemctl enable firewalld
sudo systemctl status firewalld

sudo firewall-cmd --permanent --zone=public --add-port=8020/tcp
sudo firewall-cmd --permanent --zone=public --add-port=8088/tcp
sudo firewall-cmd --permanent --zone=public --add-port=50070/tcp
sudo firewall-cmd --reload

#!/bin/bash

##############################################
# Name        : Hadoop_Master_Start.sh
# Author      : Calm Devops
# Version     : 1.0
# Description : Script to start Hadoop master services
# Compatibility : Centos 6, 7
##############################################

cd /usr/local/hadoop
bin/hadoop namenode -format

sh sbin/start-dfs.sh
sh sbin/start-yarn.sh

echo "Master service started"

if [[ "@@{Install_Sqoop}@@" == "False" ]];then exit 0 ; fi

echo "Download sqoop binary"
wget http://archive.apache.org/dist/sqoop/@@{sqoop_version}@@/@@{sqoop_binary}@@.tar.gz
tar -xvf @@{sqoop_binary}@@.tar.gz
sudo mv @@{sqoop_binary}@@ /usr/lib/sqoop
#cd /usr/lib/sqoop



#cd $SQOOP_HOME/conf
#mv sqoop-env-template.sh sqoop-env.sh
wget http://ftp.ntu.edu.tw/MySQL/Downloads/Connector-J/@@{mysql_binary}@@.tar.gz
tar -zxf @@{mysql_binary}@@.tar.gz
cd @@{mysql_binary}@@
sudo mkdir -p /usr/lib/sqoop
#sudo  mv @@{mysql_binary}@@.jar /usr/lib/sqoop/lib
sudo mv @@{mysql_binary}@@.jar /usr/lib/sqoop

echo 'export SQOOP_HOME=/usr/lib/sqoop' >> ~/.bash_profile
echo 'export SQOOP_SERVER_EXTRA_LIB=/usr/lib/sqoop' >> ~/.bash_profile
echo 'export PATH=$SQOOP_HOME/bin:$PATH' >> ~/.bash_profile
echo 'export CLASSPATH=.:$JAVA_HOME/jre/lib:$JAVA_HOME/lib:$JAVA_HOME/lib/tools.jar:$HADOOP_COMMON_HOME:$HADOOP_HDFS_HOME:$HADOOP_MAPRED_HOME:$HADOOP_YARN_HOME:SQOOP_SERVER_EXTRA_LIB' >> ~/.bash_profile

source ~/.bash_profile
# Remove the Apache Hive from the classpath to prevent java.lang.ExceptionInInitializerError during upgrade

export PATH=$JAVA_HOME/bin:$HADOOP_COMMON_HOME/bin:$SQOOP_HOME/bin:$PATH
export CLASSPATH=.:$JAVA_HOME/jre/lib:$JAVA_HOME/lib:$JAVA_HOME/lib/tools.jar:$HADOOP_COMMON_HOME:$HADOOP_HDFS_HOME:$HADOOP_MAPRED_HOME:$HADOOP_YARN_HOME:SQOOP_SERVER_EXTRA_LIB


$SQOOP_HOME/bin/sqoop2-server start

if [[ "@@{Install_Hive}@@" == "False" ]];then exit 0 ; fi

echo 'export PATH=$JAVA_HOME/bin:$HADOOP_COMMON_HOME/bin:$HIVE_HOME/bin:$PATH' >> ~/.bash_profile
source ~/.bash_profile
wget --no-check-certificate https://dlcdn.apache.org/hive/@@{hive_version}@@/apache-@@{hive_version}@@-bin.tar.gz
echo "Extracting Hive binaries"
tar -xzf apache-@@{hive_version}@@-bin.tar.gz
cd apache-@@{hive_version}@@-bin

source ~/.bash_profile
echo "Making Hadoop Temp Directory"
sudo $HADOOP_HOME/bin/hadoop fs -mkdir /tmp
sudo $HADOOP_HOME/bin/hadoop fs -mkdir -p /user/hive/warehouse
sudo $HADOOP_HOME/bin/hadoop fs -chmod g+w /tmp
sudo $HADOOP_HOME/bin/hadoop fs -chmod g+w /user/hive/warehouse
echo "Testing the Hive cli"
$HIVE_HOME/bin/hive --version

#!/bin/bash

set -ex

##############################################
# Name        : Hadoop_Master_uninstall.sh
# Author      : Calm Devops
# Version     : 1.0
# Description : Script to uninstall hadoop master 
# Compatibility : Centos 6, 7
##############################################


sudo yum remove -y wget java-1.8.0-openjdk
sudo yum -y remove cloudera-cdh-5-0.x86_64.rpm 
sudo yum -y remove zookeeper-server
sudo yum -y remove hadoop*

sudo yum install -y --quiet lvm2 libudev-devel
pv_list=""		# This variable will store all the unused/unclaimed disks
for x in {a..z}; do
   if [ -e /dev/sd$x ];	# For all providers except AWS
   then
      data_flag=`sudo file -sL /dev/sd$x | cut -d ':' -f2 | tr -d ' '`	# It will be 'data' if disk is not claimed / used
      if [ "$data_flag" == "data" ]
      then
      sudo pvcreate /dev/sd$x
      pv_list+="/dev/sd$x "
      fi
   elif [ -e /dev/xvd$x ];	# AWS disks
   then
      data_flag=`sudo file -sL /dev/xvd$x | cut -d ':' -f2 | tr -d ' '`
      if [ "$data_flag" == "data" ]
      then
        sudo pvcreate /dev/xvd$x
        pv_list+="/dev/xvd$x "
      fi
   fi
done

if [[ ! -z $pv_list ]]; then
	eval sudo vgcreate vg01 $pv_list # vg01 is created with all unclaimed / unused disks
    if [[ `sudo vgdisplay vg01` ]];then echo "vg01 already exists";exit 0;fi
    sudo lvcreate -l 100%VG -n lv01 vg01	# lv01 is created from vg01
	sudo mkfs.xfs /dev/vg01/lv01
	echo -e "/dev/vg01/lv01 \t /opt \t xfs \t defaults \t 0 0" | sudo tee -a /etc/fstab # lv01 is mounted to /opt
	sudo mount -a
fi

sudo yum install -y --quiet lvm2 libudev-devel
pv_list=""		# This variable will store all the unused/unclaimed disks
for x in {a..z}; do
   if [ -e /dev/sd$x ];	# For all providers except AWS
   then
      data_flag=`sudo file -sL /dev/sd$x | cut -d ':' -f2 | tr -d ' '`	# It will be 'data' if disk is not claimed / used
      if [ "$data_flag" == "data" ]
      then
      sudo pvcreate /dev/sd$x
      pv_list+="/dev/sd$x "
      fi
   elif [ -e /dev/xvd$x ];	# AWS disks
   then
      data_flag=`sudo file -sL /dev/xvd$x | cut -d ':' -f2 | tr -d ' '`
      if [ "$data_flag" == "data" ]
      then
        sudo pvcreate /dev/xvd$x
        pv_list+="/dev/xvd$x "
      fi
   fi
done

if [[ ! -z $pv_list ]]; then
	eval sudo vgcreate vg01 $pv_list # vg01 is created with all unclaimed / unused disks
    if [[ `sudo vgdisplay vg01` ]];then echo "vg01 already exists";exit 0;fi
    sudo lvcreate -l 100%VG -n lv01 vg01	# lv01 is created from vg01
	sudo mkfs.xfs /dev/vg01/lv01
	echo -e "/dev/vg01/lv01 \t /opt \t xfs \t defaults \t 0 0" | sudo tee -a /etc/fstab # lv01 is mounted to /opt
	sudo mount -a
fi

spec.name: Hadoop
